title: Stock Futures Edge Down Ahead of Bank Earnings; JPMorgan Chase and Morgan Stanley are due to report before the opening bell
text:
In Europe, the Stoxx Europe 600 lost 0.2% in morning trade as gains in energy and real-estate sectors were balanced by losses in healthcare and consumer staples sectors.

The U.K.'s FTSE 100 fell 0.1%. Other stock indexes in Europe were mixed as the U.K.'s FTSE 250 meandered after the flat line, whereas France's CAC 40 was lower 0.4% and Germany's DAX shed 0.2%.

The Swiss franc, the euro and the British pound depreciated 0.6%, 0.2% and 0.2% respectively against the U.S. dollar.

In commodities, international benchmark Brent crude was down 0.8% to $98.82 a barrel. Gold was also down 1.1% to $1,715.80 a troy ounce.

The German 10-year bund yield was up to 1.185% and 10-year gilts yields were up to 2.093%. The yield on 10-year U.S. Treasury strengthened to 2.952% from 2.904%. Yields and prices move in opposite directions.

Indexes in Asia were mixed as Japan's Nikkei 225 index climbed 0.6%, whereas Hong Kong's Hang Seng fell 0.3% and China's benchmark Shanghai Composite was shed 0.1%.

Stock Futures Edge Down Ahead of Bank Earnings
